intro: Sabia parviflora subsp. philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine small-flowered sabia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a slightly rough texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
